info.name: PHR APP
info.description:
Description:

- The PHR App collection provides APIs for managing personal health records (PHR) and subscriptions linked to ABHA addresses.
    
- It enables creation, retrieval, and updating of personal health records, along with generating encrypted QR codes for secure access.
    
- The collection also supports subscription management, including requesting, approving, rejecting, and editing subscriptions, as well as setting up personal health lockers.
    
- Auto-approval functionality is included, allowing subscriptions or lockers to be approved automatically, with endpoints to enable, disable, and check the status.
    
- Overall, the APIs facilitate seamless and secure management of health data, access control, and interoperability across healthcare services.

item.name: 1. phr app login

request.description:
**Description**

- Initiates the login process by sending an OTP to the user’s mobile number.
    
- The client provides a mobile number (and optionally a hash string), and the server generates and sends an OTP via SMS.
    

Body

``` json
{
  "hashString": "",
  "mobileNum": "8790447915"
}

 ```

Response

``` json
{
  "status": true,
  "message": "OTP sent successfully"
}

 ```

Notes

- `hashString` may be used for additional validation depending on the app’s security flow.
    
- The mobile number must be valid and accessible to receive OTPs.

response.name: 200 success

request.description:
Description

- Verifies the OTP sent to the user’s mobile number during the login process.
    
- If the OTP is valid, the server completes authentication and returns login/session details.
    

Body

``` json
{
  "mobileNum": "8790447915",
  "otp": "763327"
}

 ```

Response

``` json
{
    "message": "OTP verified successfully"
}

 ```

Notes

- The OTP must match the one previously sent for the same mobile number.
    
- On successful verification, the user is authenticated and typically receives a token for subsequent requests.

response.name: 200 success

request.description:
Description

- Generates or retrieves an application-level authentication token for the user based on their mobile number.
    
- This token is typically used for secure app operations after login.
    

Body

``` json
{
  "mobNum": "8790447915",
  "tag": ""
}

 ```

Response

``` json
{
    "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJtb2JudW0iOiI4NzkwNDQ3OTE1Iiwic2Vzc2lvbklEIjoiNjNmZGJiOWMtNzhkOC00ZjgwLTgwNjAtMDNlMjlhMWFkMDk4IiwiaWF0IjoxNzY0ODI3MTk1LCJleHAiOjE3NjQ4NDg3OTV9.owGhJH_NP06N2CyPVYp4pu-yKYf9l1_MIBRbBWmOe2M"
}

 ```

Notes

- `mobNum` must belong to an already authenticated user.
    
- `tag` can be used to identify the device or context if your system supports multi-device tokens.

request.description:
Description

- Retrieves the ABHA (Ayushman Bharat Health Account) QR code details for a user.
    
- The client provides an `abhaNumber`, and the server returns the user’s QR-related information.
    
- A valid Bearer token {{xAuthToken}} is required.
    

Response

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "response": "",
        "authToken": "eyJhbGciOiJSUzUxMiJ9..GyW9qLhPPG_ye8QXnoRQ4weNCtglC9Db9hxTwuWsJDt3WWO2hhDb6Y7-d4iCKDgjlr3HQXPkwTZID6-qJehxGtDJe_05ETszreaVU7v-O0yLjtPTfBhqdlh5IdBId8S5LFfS5FsS2fz4pvLfMsNUAUkGFX0nVaBMsf295hMmIfX8hhlS-spOpJpK4f9BNrRgtRAxsYHdjwPBmKW5ipYB1N0Hho1vaikC6B8ABIFN38sS7DJezGj7MeYsV0f7mDEm74MyaXhXaHkQtNuN6_uMIaukD5zecfx1xuPjZ_SvsmHQF9SZ0_UO6how0LXlRd3hGwDGn-Xa3VzJVy1LVNXAKQ"
    }
}

 ```

Note

- Requires a **xAuthToken**, not the regular app login token.
    
- `abhaNumber` must be valid and linked to the authenticated user's profile.
    
- The QR code is usually returned in a Base64 image format for embedding or rendering.

request.description:
Description

- Logs out the user associated with the provided `abhaNumber`.
    
- This endpoint terminates the user’s active session and invalidates the authentication token.
    

Response

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "message": "You have been logged out",
        "timestamp": "2025-12-04 11:28:46"
    }
}

 ```

Notes

- Requires a valid **Bearer token** from the user’s login session.
    
- `abhaNumber` is used to identify which ABHA-linked session to terminate.
    
- After logout, the token is no longer valid for further requests.

item.description:
Summary

- **POST /auth/login/otp** — Sends an OTP to the user’s mobile number to start the login process.
    
- **POST /auth/verify/login/otp** — Verifies the OTP entered by the user to complete login.
    
- **POST /auth/token/app** — Generates an application-level token for authenticated user access.
    
- **GET /profile/info/find** — Retrieves the user’s profile information using their identifier.
    
- **GET /profile/info/qr-code** — Fetches the ABHA QR code and related profile details.
    
- **GET /profile/info/logout** — Logs out the user and invalidates their session token.

item.description:
Summary

- **GET /phr/discover/carecontext** — Finds and returns all available care contexts linked to a patient’s ABHA Number from the ABDM ecosystem.
    
- **GET /phr/patient/care-contexts?limit=20** — Fetches the patient’s linked care contexts (up to the specified limit) from ABDM using their ABHA Address and active session.

request.description:
**Description**:

- Marks **all notifications** for the specified patient ABHA address as seen, updating their read status in the system.
    

**Path Parameter:**

- `abhaAddress` – The ABHA address of the patient whose notifications are to be marked as seen.
    

**Response:**

``` json
{
    "modifiedCount": 17
}

 ```

**Notes**:

- Requires a valid JWT token and matching ABHA address.
    
- After this call, all notifications fetched for the patient will show as read/seen.

request.description:
**Description:**

- Creates a new notification for a patient’s ABHA address, allowing the system or modules to push updates such as new care contexts, lab reports, or informational messages.
    

**Body:**

``` json
{
  "type": "INFO",
  "module": "NEW_CARE_CONTEXT",
  "message": "New care context created for your profile by SwasthX Hospital.",
  "abhaAddress": "{{abhaAddress}}",
  "metadata": {
    "careContextId": "CCID_7845321",
    "visitId": "VIS_0909_9935",
    "hospitalName": "SwasthX Hospital"
  }
}

 ```

**Response:**

``` json
{
  "status": true,
  "message": "Notification created successfully",
  "data": {
    "notificationId": "69281417e2bda294479b9cec",
    "type": "INFO",
    "abhaAddress": "suhaas_2025@sbx",
    "seen": false
  }
}

 ```

**Notes**:

- Requires a valid JWT token for authentication.
    
- Metadata is optional but recommended for contextual notifications (e.g., linking to care contexts or visits).
    
- Newly created notifications default to `seen: false` until marked as seen by the patient.

item.description:
Summary

- **GET /phr/notifications/{abhaAddress}** – Retrieves all notifications for a patient’s ABHA address.
    
- **PATCH /phr/notifications/{notificationId}/seen** – Marks a specific notification as seen for the patient.
    
- **PATCH /phr/notifications/{abhaAddress}/seen-all** – Marks all notifications for a patient as seen.
    
- **POST /phr/notifications/create** – Creates a new notification for a patient with optional metadata.

request.description:
Description:

- Revokes one or multiple active consent requests for a patient. After revocation, the HIP will no longer have access to the specified health records.
    

Body:

``` json
{
    "consents": [
        "4b01241b-3516-4315-b4e6-d3d836a12e95"
    ]
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
  "message": "Consent request(s) revoked successfully",
  "revokedConsents": [
    "4b01241b-3516-4315-b4e6-d3d836a12e95"
  ]
}

 ```

This response confirms that the HIP(s) will no longer have access to the associated health records.

**Note**:

- A valid abhaAddress of the user needs to be sent
    
- A valid xAuthToken which was obtained after verifying the abha profile needs to be sent. Make sure the xAuthToken is not expired.
    
- A valid X-CM-ID should be sent.

Description:

- Retrieves all care contexts (e.g., visits, wellness records, prescriptions) linked to a patient’s ABHA number. Can optionally filter results by date range. Useful for seeing which healthcare providers or facilities have shared patient data with the user.
    

Body:

``` json
{
  "fromDate": "2025-11-23T07:29:00.000Z",
  "toDate": "2025-12-05T08:29:00.000Z"
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
  "message": "Linked care contexts retrieved successfully",
  "careContexts": [
    {
      "careContextId": "67bdb7d48b797bdb5742f62a-WellnessRecord",
      "careContextName": "Wellness Record",
      "hip": {
        "id": "arogyaId-facility",
        "name": "SwasthX Hospital"
      },
      "patientReference": "ARID8",
      "linkedAt": "2025-11-25T10:15:30.000Z"
    }
  ]
}

 ```

**Notes:**

- Returns all care contexts linked to the ABHA number.
    
- Can be filtered by date range using `fromDate` and `toDate`.
    
- Requires valid `sessionId` and `Authorization` token.

item.description:
Summary

- **Approve Consent Request** – Approves a pending consent request for a patient, granting specified HIP/HITSP access to selected health data.
    
- **Get Consent Requests** – Retrieves all consent requests for a patient filtered by status (e.g., REQUESTED, APPROVED).
    
- **Revoke Consent** – Revokes one or more previously granted consents, immediately terminating HIP/HITSP access.
    
- **Get Linked Care Contexts** – Fetches all care contexts linked to a patient’s ABHA number.
    
- **Get Consent Artefact** – Retrieves the formal record (artefact) of a consent request for auditing or verification purposes.

item.name: doctors

request.description:

request.description:
**Description:**

- Fetches detailed information of a doctor by ID.
    

Body

``` json
{
  "id": "123456"
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "id": "123456",
    "name": "Dr. C",
    "speciality": "Cardiologist",
    "experience": 10,
    "fee": 500,
    "contact": "9876543210",
    "clinic": "Heart Plus Clinic",
    "address": "123, MG Road, City"
  }
}

 ```

Note:

- This is a POST request; ID is mandatory.
    
- A valid doctor id should be sent to fetch profile

request.description:
**Description:**

- Allows uploading media files (e.g., images, certificates) for doctor profile without authentication.
    

Body:

``` json
{
   "url": "HTTPS://SampleUploadURL.com"
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Media uploaded successfully",
  "data": {
    "mediaId": "med123456",
    "url": "https://cdn.swasthx.com/media/med123456.jpg"
  }
}

 ```

**Notes:**

- Typically used to attach media to doctor profiles before full registration; sessionId and ABHA ID are required for tracking.

item.description:
Summary

- **Get Nearby Doctors** – Retrieves a list of doctors near a specified location within a maximum distance.
    
- **Search Doctors by Filters** – Fetches doctors filtered by specialty, consultation fee, and experience range.
    
- **Get Doctor Profile** – Returns detailed information of a doctor by their unique ID.
    
- **Upload Doctor Media (Unauthenticated)** – Uploads media files (e.g., images, certificates) for a doctor profile without full authentication.

item.name: medicine order creation

request.description:
**Description:**

- Checks if medicine delivery is available in a specific city.
    

**Method:** GET

**Query Parameters:**

- `city` – Name of the city to check serviceability (e.g., `noida`)
    

**Notes:** Useful before showing available medicines to users in a particular location.

Response:

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "serviceable": true,
        "otc_available": true,
        "pharma_available": true,
        "city": "visakhapatnam"
    },
    "status_code": 200
}

 ```

response.name: 200 success

request.description:
**Description:**

- Searches for medicines in a given city with optional filters like type and pagination.
    

**Method:** GET

**Query Parameters:**

- `city` – City name
    
- `perPage` – Number of results per page
    
- `searchText` – Medicine name or keyword
    
- `types` – Filter types (e.g., `sku, allopathy`)
    

**Headers:**

- `X-Access-Key`, `X-City`, `Authorization`
    

**Notes:** Returns medicine list with SKU, type, manufacturer, and pricing info.

**Response**: Please refer to the 200 success response attached to this endpoint.

response.name: 200 success

request.description:
**Description:**

- Retrieves a paginated list of all medicine orders for a user.
    

**Method:** GET

**Query Parameters:**

- `page` – Page number
    
- `size` – Number of records per page
    
- `contact` – User mobile number
    
- `provder` – Provider type (e.g., INTERNAL)
    
- `type` – Order type (MEDICINE_ORDER)
    

**Headers:** `abhaaddress`

**Notes:** Useful for order history and tracking.

Response: Please refer to the response attached to this endpoint.

response.name: 200 success

**Description:**

- Fetches details of an over-the-counter (OTC) medicine by SKU.
    

**Method:** GET

**Path Parameter:** `26689` – SKU of the medicine

**Headers:** `Accept: application/json`

**Notes:** Returns detailed information such as composition, brand, price, and availability.

- Fetches details of a prescription (Rx) medicine by SKU.
    

**Method:** GET

**Path Parameter:** `26689` – SKU of the medicine

**Headers:** `Accept: application/json`

**Notes:** Similar to OTC endpoint, but for prescription drugs requiring medical approval.

item.description:
Summary

**GET** **`/one-mg/medicines/serviceability?city={city}`** –

- Checks if medicine delivery is available in a specified city.
    

**GET** **`/one-mg/medicines?perPage={n}&city={city}&searchText={text}&types={type}`** –

- Searches for medicines in a city with filters like type, keyword, and pagination.
    

**POST** **`/one-mg/medicines/check/inventory`** –

- Checks inventory availability of selected medicine SKUs for a given pincode and user.
    

**POST** **`/provider-order/initiate-payment`** –

- Initiates payment for a medicine order, supporting COD or online payment.
    

**POST** **`/provider-order/confirm-order`** –

- Confirms the medicine order after successful payment.
    

**GET** **`/provider-order?page={page}&size={size}&contact={mobile}&provder={provider}&type=MEDICINE_ORDER`** –

- Retrieves a paginated list of all medicine orders for a user.
    

**GET** **`/one-mg/medicines/otc/{sku}`** –

- Fetches detailed information of an over-the-counter (OTC) medicine by SKU.
    

**GET** **`/one-mg/medicines/drug/{sku}`** –

- Fetches detailed information of a prescription (Rx) medicine by SKU.

item.description:
Summary

- **`/v2/lab-test/check/city`** – Checks if lab test services are available in a specific city.
    
- **`/v2/lab-test`** – Searches for lab tests based on a keyword.
    
- **`/v2/lab-test/inventory`** – Checks inventory and serviceability of a lab test at a given city/pincode.
    
- **`/v2/lab-test/slots`** – Fetches available time slots for booking lab tests.
    
- **`/v2/lab-test/popular`** – Retrieves a list of popular lab tests.

item.name: abha process creation/update

request.description:
Description:

- Triggers an OTP to the user’s mobile number for login authentication.
    
- Requires the ABHA-linked Bearer token since the system validates the request origin.
    

Notes:

- Requires **Authorization: Bearer**
    
- No sessionId needed
    
- OTP is sent via NDHM-compliant SMS service
    
- Returns a transaction token (T-token) or success message
    

Body:

``` json
{
  "mobileNumber": "8790447915"
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "txnId": "0750459e-2b7d-4873-8fa8-7e06ab5e2123",
        "message": "OTP is sent to Mobile number ending with ******7915"
    }
}

 ```

response.name: 200 success

request.description:
Description:

- Validates the OTP submitted by the user and generates a **T-token** for the next step.
    
- This token represents a temporary login session.
    

Notes:

- No Authorization header required
    
- Must use the same mobile number used during OTP generation
    
- T-token expires quickly (usually 3–5 mins)
    

Body:

``` json
{
  "mobileNumber": "8790447915",
  "otpValue": "386207"
}

 ```

item.description:
Summary

Abha process update handles the complete flow for login OTP, verifying users via ABHA, and generating OTPs for updating mobile and email in the PHR profile.

### **`/login/mobile/generate/otp`**

Sends an OTP to the user’s mobile number to start the login process.

### **`/login/mobile/verify/otp`**

Verifies the OTP and issues a temporary login token (T-token).

**`/login/mobile/verify/user`**

Validates the user’s ABHA address using the T-token and completes login.

### **`/phr/profile/update-mobile/generate/otp`**

Sends an OTP to the new mobile number for updating the user’s mobile.

### **`/phr/profile/update-email/generate/otp`**

Sends an OTP to the new email for updating the user’s email address.

item.name: scan and share

request.description:
**Description:**

- This endpoint allows sharing a patient’s personal health record (PHR) with a Health Information User (HIU) using their HIU ID.
    
- It requires basic patient identification details such as mobile number, ABHA number, and a generated code for authentication.
    

Body:

``` json
{
    "mobile": "8790447915",
    "abhaNumber": "91-5608-2118-2121",
    "hiuId": "IN3610001058",
    "code": "code"
}

 ```

**Response: Please refer to the response attached to this endpoint.**

**Notes:**

- `hiuId` must be valid and registered with the system.
    
- The `code` acts as a one-time authentication token.
    
- Returns a response with share confirmation and request ID.

response.name: 200 success

request.description:
**Description:**

- This endpoint checks the status or retrieves the data that was previously shared with an HIU using the request ID.
    
- It ensures that the recipient or system can confirm the data has been successfully shared and access it if needed.
    

Body:

``` json
{
  "mobile": "string",
  "abhaNumber": "string",
  "hipId": "string",
  "code": "string"
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
    "message": "data successfully fetched",
    "data": {
        "_id": "6926f46c04bbdd6e887f0682",
        "requestId": "f26043bd-f439-4073-b00b-5b87f44edbbd",
        "hipId": "IN3610001058",
        "abhaAddress": "suhaas_2025@sbx",
        "status": "SUCCESS",
        "createdAt": "2025-11-26T12:37:00.684Z",
        "updatedAt": "2025-11-26T12:37:00.684Z",
        "__v": 0,
        "tokenDetails": {
            "context": "12345",
            "tokenNumber": "1",
            "expiry": "1800"
        }
    }
}

 ```

**Notes:**

- `requestId` is mandatory to track the shared PHR.
    
- Returns status of the request and available shared data.
    
- Helps HIUs confirm the availability and integrity of the shared health record.

item.description:
Summary

**POST /profile/share/hip** -

- Shares a patient’s personal health record with a specified HIU using authentication details.
    

**GET /profile/share/data?requestId=f26043bd-f439-4073-b00b-5b87f44edbbd** -

- Retrieves the status or content of health data shared with an HIU using a request ID.

item.name: user initiated linking

request.description:
**Description:**

- This endpoint triggers an ABHA-based discovery request to fetch the list of available health records from a specified HIP.
    
- It validates the patient details and initiates a discovery session that returns a request ID for fetching records.
    

Body:

``` json
{
  "hip": "IN3610001058",
  "mobileNumber": "8790447915",
  "abhaNumber": "91-5608-2118-2121",
  "healthID": "suhaas_2025@sbx"
}

 ```

**Response:**

``` json
{
    "message": "record request sent successfully",
    "data": "6b2751ff-7c10-40af-8533-eda041a13744"
}

 ```

**Notes**

- Requires valid `sessionId`, `abhaAddress`, and Authorization bearer token.
    
- The returned data includes a `requestId` used for API 2.
    
- HIP must be ABHA-registered for the discovery to work.

response.name: 200 success

request.description:
**Description:**

- This endpoint retrieves the results of the discovery operation triggered in API 1.
    
- It returns grouped PHR records, categorized by encounter, care context, and HI types.
    

**Notes:**

- Requires the same `sessionId` and `abhaAddress`.
    
- `requestID` must match the one returned by the discovery API.
    
- Used to display available PHR records to the user before linking.
    

Response:

``` json
{
    "message": "discver data fetched",
    "data": null
}

 ```

response.name: 200 success

request.description:
Description:

- This API links selected care contexts (prescriptions, lab reports, visits, etc.) to the user’s ABHA profile.
    
- It confirms which records should be attached and establishes a formal link between user identity and care contexts.
    

Body:

``` json
{
  "abhaNumber": "91-5608-2118-2121",
  "requestId": "ae7cce60-6821-4648-a475-00f2311eedb4",
  "patient": [
    {
      "referenceNumber": "AID4",
      "display": "suhaas",
      "careContexts": [
        {
          "referenceNumber": "67c5db49384839d9f1348705-Prescription",
          "display": "suhaas visit-Prescription"
        }
      ],
      "hiType": "Prescription",
      "count": 1
    }
  ]
}

 ```

**Response:** Please refer to the response attached to the endpoint.

**Notes:**

- The care contexts listed **must be fetched from API 2**.
    
- The linking request must include the exact `requestId` used during discovery.
    
- Successfully linking the records allows the user to share them later with HIUs.

Description:

- StartFragmentThis endpoint fetches the final status of the care-context linking request.
    
- It confirms whether the care contexts were successfully linked or if any failure occurred.EndFragment
    

Notes:

- Must be called using the same `requestId` from API 3.
    
- Returns the link status such as _SUCCESS_, _FAILED_, or _PARTIAL_.
    
- Use this before allowing the user to share health records with HIUs.
    

Response:

``` json
{
    "message": "discver data fetched",
    "data": null
}

 ```

response.name: 200 success

**Description:**

- This endpoint retrieves available government health programs associated with the ABHA system.
    
- It helps users view programs they are eligible for or can participate in.
    

**Notes:**

- Requires authentication headers (`sessionId`, `abhaAddress`, `Authorization`).
    
- Returns program metadata including program name, description, start/end dates, and eligibility criteria.
    
- Useful for integrating government health initiatives into patient-facing apps.

**Description:**

- This endpoint fetches a list of healthcare providers filtered by name. It allows users to search for specific hospitals, clinics, or organizations registered in the ABHA ecosystem.
    

**Notes:**

- Requires valid `sessionId` and `abhaAddress` headers.
    
- Supports query parameters like `name` for filtering.
    
- Returns provider details such as name, address, contact info, and identifiers.
    
- Useful for populating search lists or dropdowns of healthcare providers in apps.

item.description:
Summary

- **POST /phr/discover** – Initiates discovery of health records from a HIP.
    
- **GET /phr/discover/records** – Fetches the discovered PHR records using the request ID.
    
- **POST /phr/link/carecontext** – Links selected care-contexts (records) to the ABHA profile.
    
- **GET /phr/link/response** – Retrieves the final status of the care-context linking request.

item.name: discoverability

request.description:
Description:

- This endpoint searches across discoverable entities—such as doctors, labs, clinics, medicines, or services—based on user input.
    
- It filters results using location, type, and pincode to return the most relevant matches.
    

Query Parameters:

| Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **search** | string | yes | The keyword or name to search (doctor name, lab name, medicine, etc.) |
| **city** | string | yes | City used to narrow down discoverability results |
| **types** | string | no | Optional filter for specific categories — e.g., `sku`, `lab`, `doctor` |
| **pincode** | string | no | Additional filter to refine search by region |

Response: Please refer to the response attached to this endpoint.

Notes:

- This API acts as a **unified discovery engine** across multiple categories.
    
- The `types` parameter helps restrict results; use comma-separated values when needed.
    
- Best used for autocomplete search bars or quick lookups.
    
- Response fields may differ depending on whether the entity is a doctor, lab, SKU, etc.

response.name: 200 success

item.description:
Summary

**GET /discoverability** – Searches for doctors, labs, clinics, medicines, or services using search text, city, type, and pincode filters.

item.name: provider order

query.description: Use LAB_TEST for labtest orders & MEDICINE_ORDER for medicine orders

request.description:
Description:

- Fetches a paginated list of provider orders (medical, lab, etc.) created for the user.
    
- Supports filtering by mobile number, provider type, and order category.
    

Notes:

- Requires **mobile number** to fetch user-specific orders.
    
- Pagination parameters (`page`, `size`) are mandatory.
    
- Returns list + meta info such as status, pricing, timestamps.
    

Response: Please refer to the response attached to the endpoint.

response.name: 200 success

query.description: Use LAB_TEST for labtest orders & MEDICINE_ORDER for medicine orders

request.description:
Description:

- StartFragmentCancels a provider order using its unique order
    
- A cancellation reason can be sent in the body to record context for auditing.
    

Notes:

- The order must be in a status that still allows cancellation.
    
- Some orders (e.g., shipped medicine orders) may not be cancelable.
    
- Requires a minimal JSON body with a `reason`.
    

Body:

``` json
{
  "reason": "Order created by mistake"
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Order cancelled successfully",
  "orderId": "R331ZAP"
}

 ```

Description:

- Fetches the complete details of a specific provider order.
    
- Includes doctor/lab details, patient details, order items, and full status history.
    

Notes:

- No request body required.
    
- Useful for building order detail screens in app UI.
    
- Gives full audit trail and item breakdown.

request.description:
Description:

- Partially updates specific fields of an existing provider order.
    
- Used for updating notes, appointment details, or status transitions.
    

Notes:

- Supports partial updates only — fields not included remain unchanged.
    
- Useful for internal operations or workflow transitions.
    
- Body content varies depending on update type.
    

Body:

``` json
{
    "addressId": "68ada2bb98a65dd4e9aa200c",
    "Oldtime": "2025-08-29T13:20:00.000Z",
    
    "bookedSlot": {
        "status": "Reschedule",
        "time": "2025-12-30T13:20:00.000Z",
        "slotId": "",
        "typeOfSlot": "in-clinic",
        "slot": "morningSlot",
        "day": "Tuesday",
        "duration": "10"
    }
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
  "success": true,
  "message": "Order updated successfully",
  "orderId": "R331ZAP"
}

 ```

Description:

- Fetches the live order status from the OneMG partner for the specified provider order.
    
- Used to sync real-time updates like "Packed", "Shipped", "Out for Delivery", etc.
    

Notes:

- Requires multiple headers: **Authorization**, **sessionId**, **abhaAddress**.
    
- Returns the external partner’s latest status mapped to internal status codes.
    
- Critical for medicine orders placed via OneMG.
    

Response:

``` json
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "orderId": "R331ZAP",
    "partner": "ONE_MG",
    "status": "OUT_FOR_DELIVERY",
    "lastUpdated": "2025-01-10T12:40:00.000Z",
    "rawStatus": "Out for delivery"
  }
}

 ```

Description:

- Returns a list of frequently booked providers (doctors, labs, or services) for the logged-in user.
    
- Used for quick-repeat booking recommendations in the app.
    

Notes:

- Requires **sessionId**, **Authorization**, and **abhaAddress** in headers.
    
- Results depend on the user's previous orders and interaction history.
    
- `type` decides the category: `DOC_APPOINTMENT`, `LAB_TEST`, `MEDICINE_ORDER`, etc.
    

Response: Please refer to the response attached to the endpoint.

item.description:
Endpoints and Description:

**GET /provider-order?page=&size=&contact=&provider=&type=**

- Fetches a paginated list of provider orders filtered by contact, provider type, and order type.
    

**DELETE /provider-order/{orderId}**

- Cancels a provider order using its order ID, with a reason supplied in the request body.
    

**GET /provider-order/{orderId}**

- Retrieves full details of a specific provider order, including status, doctor info, and timestamps.
    

**GET /provider-order/doctors?mobile=**

- Returns the list of doctors linked to the user’s provider-order interactions based on their mobile number.
    

**PATCH /provider-order/{orderId}**

- Updates specific fields of a provider order such as status, notes, or appointment details.
    

Summary

- **Get Provider Orders** — Fetches paginated provider orders filtered by contact, provider, and type.
    
- **Cancel Provider Order** — Cancels a provider order using its ID with a reason.
    
- **Get Provider Order Details** — Retrieves complete order details including items, patient info, and timeline.
    
- **Get Doctors for Provider Orders** — Returns doctors previously associated with the user’s provider orders.
    
- **Update Provider Order** — Partially updates order metadata such as status or remarks.
    
- **Get OneMG Order Status** — Retrieves real-time order status from OneMG for a given provider order.
    
- **Get Popular Providers** — Returns frequently booked providers for faster repeat appointments.

item.name: rewards

request.description:
Description:

- This endpoint fetches the system-wide rewards configuration, such as the point-to-currency conversion ratio.
    
- It is mainly used to understand how reward redemption or point calculation should work for the user.
    

Notes

- Any JSON body sent in this GET call is ignored — not used by backend.
    
- Use this API to dynamically configure how many currency units a user gets per reward point.
    
- Helpful for checkout screens, payment calculations, and reward summaries.
    

Response:

``` json
{
    "_id": "690ca6fcadc02205e8295295",
    "pointToCurrencyRatio": 1,
    "createdAt": "2025-11-06T13:47:40.372Z",
    "updatedAt": "2025-11-06T13:51:07.315Z",
    "__v": 0
}

 ```

Description:

- This endpoint fetches the user’s reward information based on their mobile number.
    
- It may include total points, available balance, and past reward activities or transactions.
    

Notes

- Requires only the `mobile` query parameter.
    
- Ideal for reward dashboards, checkout payment redemption, and user profile sections.
    
- Response structure may include additional metadata depending on the backend.
    

Response: Please refer to the response attached to the endpoint.

item.description:
Summary

**GET /rewards/setting** – Retrieves the platform’s reward configuration, including point-to-currency rules.

**GET /rewards** – Returns the rewards balance and transaction history for a user based on their mobile number.

item.name: delivery address

request.description:
Description:

- Creates a new delivery address for a user linked to their ABHA address and contact number.
    
- Used whenever a user adds a new home, work, or alternate delivery address in the app.
    

Notes:

- Requires **abhaaddress** header.
    
- All address fields must be provided; server validates pincode, city, and userId.
    
- If the user has multiple addresses, this will be added as an additional address.
    

Response:

``` json
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Address added successfully.",
    "data": {
        "contact": "9876543214",
        "userId": "684147482d5062d3d251ed25",
        "abhaAddress": "muvvala_20010605@sbx",
        "houseFlatBlock": "House 40",
        "apartmentRoadArea": "Puichli Gali 2",
        "street": "PJR NAGAR",
        "pincode": "500032",
        "city": "Hydrabad",
        "state": "Telengana",
        "addressType": "Home",
        "_id": "69326fa9414aacaddeb0b891",
        "createdAt": "2025-12-05T05:37:45.063Z",
        "updatedAt": "2025-12-05T05:37:45.063Z",
        "__v": 0
    }
}

 ```

response.name: 200 success

request.description:
Description:

- Fetches all delivery addresses linked to a user using their contact number.
    
- Useful for showing the “Saved Addresses” list during checkout.
    

Notes:

- Needs **abhaaddress** header for user identity mapping.
    
- Returns empty list if the user has no saved addresses.

request.description:
Description:

- Fetches a specific delivery address using its unique address ID.
    
- Often used when editing an existing address and you need to prefill the form.
    

Notes:

- Requires **abhaaddress** header.
    
- If ID is invalid, server returns a 404-style error.
    

Response:

``` json
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Address retrieved successfully.",
    "data": {
        "_id": "6903347802b7b02f7a7ec77b",
        "contact": "8790447915",
 ```

request.description:
Description:

- Deletes a saved delivery address permanently from the user's profile.
    
- Useful for cleaning up old addresses or removing invalid ones.
    

Notes:

- Needs **abhaaddress** header.
    
- Cannot be undone; the user must re-add the address if needed.
    
- Fails if the address ID does not exist.
    

Response:

``` json
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Address deleted successfully."
}

 ```

request.description:
Description:

- This API approves a pending PHR data-sharing subscription request for the given transaction ID.
    
- It allows the user to grant consent to share their health data with the requesting HIP/HIE according to the specified categories, period, and purpose.
    

Notes:

- Requires valid **sessionId**, **Authorization token**, **X-CM-ID**, and **abhaAddress**.
    
- Approval grants access based on the shared purpose, HI types, and period.
    
- Includes detailed consent metadata like categories and applicable HIPs.
    

Body:

``` json
{
    "isApplicableForAllHIPs": true,
    "includedSources": [
        {
            "hiTypes": [
                "DiagnosticReport",
                "Prescription",
                "ImmunizationRecord",
                "DischargeSummary",
                "OPConsultation",
                "HealthDocumentRecord",
                "WellnessRecord"
            ],
            "purpose": {
                "text": "Care Management",
                "code": "CAREMGT",
                "refUri": "www.abdm.gov.in"
            },
            "categories": [
                "LINK",
                "DATA"
            ],
            "period": {
                "from": "2025-01-01T09:00:00.000Z",
                "to": "2025-12-31T09:00:00.000Z"
            }   
        }
    ],
    "excludedSources": []
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
  "message": "Subscription approved successfully",
  "status": "SUCCESS",
  "transactionId": "3cfbb42f-bbb3-46d1-87e9-15c6a7f2166d"
}

 ```

Description:

- This API denies or rejects a pending PHR subscription request.
    
- It prevents the requesting HIP/HIE from accessing or linking the user's health data.
    

Notes:

- Requires valid authentication headers.
    
- Useful when the patient does not want to grant data access.
    
- Denial immediately invalidates the pending request.
    

Body: Same as subscription_approve

Response:

``` json
{
  "message": "Subscription denied successfully",
  "status": "SUCCESS",
  "transactionId": "3cfbb42f-bbb3-46d1-87e9-15c6a7f2166d"
}

 ```

- Helps the user or system understand who requested data, what data is asked for, and the current status.

- Requires auth headers similar to Approve/Deny endpoints.

item.description:
Summary

These APIs manage user health data subscriptions — listing them, creating new ones, and enabling/disabling access for HIUs.

- **Get PHR QR Code:** Retrieves an encrypted QR code for the patient’s health data.
    
- **Create PHR:** Creates a new personal health record for the given ABHA address.
    
- **Update PHR:** Updates existing personal health record details.
    
- **Get PHR Details:** Fetches complete personal health record information.
    
- **Request Subscription:** Requests subscription access for a health information user.
    
- **Approve Subscription:** Approves a pending subscription request.
    
- **Reject Subscription:** Rejects a pending subscription request.
    
- **Request Subscription (By ID):** Initiates a subscription request for a specific subscription ID.
    
- **Setup Locker:** Sets up a personal health locker for the ABHA address.
    
- **Edit Subscription:** Edits an existing subscription’s details, including included/excluded sources and purposes.
    
- **Enable Auto-Approval:** Enables automatic approval for a subscription or locker.
    
- **Disable Auto-Approval:** Disables automatic approval for a subscription or locker.
    
- **Get Auto-Approval Status:** Retrieves the current auto-approval status for a given ABHA address.
    
- EndFragment

request.description:
Description:

- This API validates a user’s demographic details (name, ABHA number, ABHA address, gender, YOB) against the PHR ecosystem.
    
- It ensures that the user attempting to authenticate or perform ABHA-based actions is matched and verified correctly.

- Requires multiple important headers:
    
    - `sessionId`
        
    - `abhaAddress`
        
    - `Authorization`
        
    - `X-CM-ID`

- `requestID` can be passed empty; the backend will generate one if required.
    
- The body must include **abhaAddress**, **abhaNumber**, **name**, **gender**, **yearOfBirth**.

``` json
{
  "abhaAddress": "suhaas_2025@sbx",
  "abhaNumber": "91-5608-2118-2121",
  "name": "Suhaas Sanapathi",
  "gender": "M",
  "yearOfBirth": "1997",
  "requestID": ""
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
    "message": "Link Token already exists!"
}

 ```

item.name: ai chat

request.description:
Description:

- This API sends the full chat history (messages array) to the backend LLM engine for AI-generated responses.
    
- It is used for medical chat assistance, symptom triage, and general conversational guidance within the app.
    

Notes:

- Requires a valid **Bearer token** for authentication.
    
- Content-Type must be `application/json`.
    
- You must send the **entire conversation**, not just the last user message — the LLM responds based on full context.
    
- Each message must have a `role` (`user` | `assistant`) and `content`.
    
- The LLM response may include: diagnostic suggestions, next-question prompts, or general assistance text.
    

Body:

``` json
{
  "messages": [
    {
      "role": "user",
      "content": "I am feeling cold from 2 days maybe this is because of the ice cream I had 2 days ago"
    },
    {
      "role": "assistant",
      "content": "Hello! Thanks for reaching out..."
    }
  ]
}

 ```

Response:

``` json
{
    "role": "assistant",
    "content": "I found that you may need a specialist in [\"General Physician\"], but I couldn't find any available doctors right now. Please try again later or check the doctor appointment page to search manually."
}

 ```

response.name: 200 success

item.name: provider cart

request.description:
Description:

- This API retrieves all provider-cart items linked to a user’s ABHA address, including appointments, services, or SKUs added for checkout.
    
- It helps the app show a consolidated cart view before booking or payment.
    

Notes:

- The cart will be deleted once a successful order is placed, it can be either medicine, lab tests or doctor appointment.
    
- **Requires Authorization header** (Bearer token).
    
- **Requires sessionId header**, used for transaction tracking.
    
- `abhaAddress` must be passed both in the URL _and_ as a separate header.
    
- Response includes cart items, metadata, provider details, pricing, and status.
    
- If no cart exists, it may return an empty list instead of an error.
    
- Server validates token expiry — expired tokens return 401.
    

Response: Please refer to the response attached to this endpoint.
